text: Approved control narrative, zoning diagrams, and fixture schedules reviewed
Sensor types and locations (ceiling, wall, dual-tech) coordinated and shown on drawings
Daylight zones defined and photocells located per design and LEED intent (if applicable)
Sensors and switches installed at correct height, orientation, and range adjusted
All wall stations, keypads, dimmers, and override switches installed cleanly and labeled
Low-voltage wiring terminated, tagged, and run in dedicated conduits
Panelboard relays and lighting controllers mounted in labeled, accessible locations
Lighting control system networked with BAS (if required) and IP address mapped
Dimming and switching logic programmed as per room functions
Daylight harvesting, occupancy timeout, and override settings uploaded and tested
Zone-by-zone test for sensor response, dimming control, and relay behavior
Emergency lighting override tested and functional
Graphics interface (if applicable) reviewed with client
Final commissioning report, zone maps, and user override instructions submitted
Operator training complete and system login credentials handed off

id: • ASHRAE 90.1, NECB Lighting Controls, IECC Section C405, CSA C22.1
• Manufacturer Specs: Lutron, Crestron, Leviton, Acuity, nLight, Encelium
